description:
About Step Up  Step Up Tutoring is a California-based non-profit organization that drives student success in under-resourced communities by providing free virtual tutoring and mentorship to elementary school students. Step Up recruits, trains, and supports engaged and motivated tutors to deliver virtual high impact tutoring for students in grades 2-6. In partnership with Los Angeles Unified School District and other partners, we have served over 2,500 students to date. Our aim is to scale impactful and cost-effective relationship-based tutoring, so that it is accessible to every child in need in America.
The Role As our School & Family Program Manager, you will be based in the LA area and responsible for developing and delivering a positive experience with our partner schools and families. You will serve as the key liaison with school partners, supporting the high-quality implementation of Step Up tutoring with school staff, and leading efforts to enroll and launch students and families. You will own and oversee the end-to-end family experience, starting from developing interest to supporting actively matched students and families with any needs and issues. Serving as the face of Step Up, you will be the primary point of contact and representative for families. As a member of the Tutoring Operations team, you will own the development and delivery of cross-functional initiatives that affect our school partners and families, and find new and innovative ways to increase our reach, participation, and satisfaction.
Responsibilities
  • Build and maintain relationships with school leaders, staff, families, and community partners to promote student success
  • Drive and develop process improvements for families and schools to onboard into our program, resulting in improved quality of matches and reduced time to match
  • Drive the successful implementation of our school partnerships, supporting education, family outreach, student enrollment, and data reviews with school liaisons
  • Ensure we recruit families who are a strong fit for our program
  • Support and evolve our student recruitment strategy through schools and other channels
  • In partnership with the overall Operations team, help drive health and long-term adherence of our matches by proactively identifying and resolving issues with a data-driven mindset
  • Manage all outgoing communications to families
  • Manage a team of Family Navigators to address immediate family needs and questions via our Zendesk, SMS, and phone support system
  • Drive strong school partner and family satisfaction on our annual surveys
  • Represent the voice of school partners and families in our product and program design, advocating for their needs, providing feedback on potential changes, and proactively offering improvements to how we can deliver a more effective, scalable, and engaging experience for schools and families

Preferred Qualifications/Experience:
  • Based in LA area, some travel to school sites required 
  • BA/BS required
  • Fluency in Spanish required
  • Experience working with parents and providing information on services available to families.
  • Experience in K-12 education or tutoring is a plus
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Excellent project management and organizational skills
  • Demonstrated ability to juggle multiple priorities and work independently
  • Self-starter and initiative-taker with creative ideas
  • Interest in education & education equity
  • Flexibility and desire to learn

This job is ideal for someone who is:
  • Service-mindset: creates and maintains positive and professional relationships with program participants 
  • Data-driven: enjoys using data to build creative sourcing and closing strategy and to inform improvements over time
  • Growth-minded: eager to expand skills in a hyper-growth setting
  • Experience working with families, particularly from the communities we serve: can find effective solutions to engage and re-engage families in our program

Details:
  • Schedule: 40 hours per week
  • Some evenings and weekends required based on Pacific Time
  • Salary Range: $65,000 - $77,000, commensurate with experience 
  • Location: Los Angeles Area
  • Travel Requirements: Ability to travel to school partner sites for meetings and support on-site events

Benefits:
  • Opportunity to join a new non-profit organization on the ground floor and make a large impact on the organization’s success
  • Collaborative work environment with emphasis on learning and professional growth opportunities
  • Work at the forefront of education & innovation
  • Health and dental insurance
  • 401(k) with 4% match on contributions
﻿ Company website: https://www.stepuptutoring.org/ Submit your resume and information at www.stepuptutoring.org/jobs
